title: User session based commits
description: Is there a way in Solr to make user session based commits, i.e. like in oracle database, when a commit is executed, it saves all user data (per session) to the database, but unlike Solr, a commit saves all added documents to the Solr index.

comments.author: Erick Erickson
comments.content:
Please raise usage questions like this on the user's list rather than raise a JIRA, we try to keep these for code/documentation changes not information-level back-and-forth.

And to answer your question, its short: no.

When a commit happens to Solr/Lucene, all pending updates from whatever source are committed to the index.

comments.author: Khalid Galal
comments.content: Thanks Erick and sorry for raising usage questions on JIRA.
